error.signature: ERROR: pip's dependency resolver does not currently take into account all the packages that are installed. subprocess-exited-with-error

verdict.summary: A subprocess invoked by pip (typically setup.py or build backend) exited with a non-zero status. This is a wrapper error — the actual cause is in the subprocess output above this message. Common causes: missing build deps, syntax errors in setup.py, or incompatible build backend.

dead_ends.why_fails: This line is just the wrapper; the actual error with actionable information is in the preceding output

dead_ends.action: Upgrade pip to fix subprocess handling
dead_ends.why_fails: The error is not in pip's subprocess handling — it is in the package's build script that failed

workarounds.action: Read the full error output above the subprocess error line to find the real cause
workarounds.how: Run pip install -v <package> for verbose output, then look for the actual error (missing header, syntax error, etc.)
apt-get install build-essential python3-dev && pip install setuptools wheel && pip install <package>

workarounds.action: Try installing a specific older version that has prebuilt wheels
workarounds.how: pip install <package>==<older-version> where older version has wheels for your platform
workarounds.condition: when the latest version lacks wheels

leads_to.condition: when fixing subprocess error requires changes to build isolation

preceded_by.condition: when source build compilation failure triggers subprocess error

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Subprocess-error is a generic wrapper around any build failure; src-install-failed specifically indicates missing compilers or libraries
